messageBody:
>So said Terry Wilcox on 4/10/2003 --------------------
<snip />
>We don't have individual databases, we share a test database. Imagine what
>happens when two people run the same test at the same time against the same
>database. If your tests aren't really careful about what data they delete,
>you're going to have a lot of frustration.

Sharing a test database considered harmful.

The decision maker in that case thinks that he is saving money. Compute how much time the team spends working around this limitation over a two-week span. Project this cost over the length of the entire project. Hand the numbers to the decision maker.
